item.title: On Simplicity
item.description:
In an age of infinite complexity, simplicity is a radical act.

Every line of code is a liability. Every feature is maintenance. Every option is cognitive load.

The best interfaces disappear. They don’t ask you to think about them. They just work.

A terminal prompt. A blinking cursor. An empty page.

These are invitations, not obstacles. They say: you’re in control.

The modern web forgot this. Pop-ups asking for notifications. Cookie banners. Newsletter modals. Infinite scroll designed to trap you.

item.title: In Defense of Keyboards
item.description:
The mouse was a mistake.

Not really. But hear me out.

When you use a mouse, you’re constantly context-switching. Eyes scan for the target. Hand moves. Click. Eyes verify. Hand returns to keyboard.

With keyboard navigation, your hands never leave home row. Your eyes can stay on the content. The interface becomes invisible.

The Vim Philosophy

Vim users know this. Modal editing seems bizarre until it clicks. Then you can’t go back.
